title: scgpt_annotation
description: Run scGPT integration (cell embedding generation) followed by neighbour calculations, leiden clustering and run umap on the result.

Dataset input.title: Dataset input
Dataset input.description: Dataset input using nf-tower "dataset" or "data explorer". Allows for the input of multiple         parameter sets to initialise a Nextflow channel.

param_list.description: Dataset input can either be a list of maps, a csv file, a json file, a yaml file, or simply a yaml                 blob. The names of the input fields (e.g. csv columns, json keys) need to be an exact match with the workflow input parameters.

output.description: Type: `file`, required, default: `$id.$key.output.h5mu`, example: `output.h5mu`. The query data in
output.help_text: Type: `file`, required, default: `$id.$key.output.h5mu`, example: `output.h5mu`. The query data in .h5mu format with predicted labels.

output_obs_predictions.help_text: Type: `string`, default: `scgpt_pred`. In which `.obs` slots to store the predicted information.

output_obs_probability.help_text: Type: `string`, default: `scgpt_probabilities`. In which `.obs` slots to store the probability of the predictions.

output_compression.description: Type: `string`, example: `gzip`, choices: ``gzip`, `lzf``. The compression format to be used on the output h5mu object
output_compression.help_text: Type: `string`, example: `gzip`, choices: ``gzip`, `lzf``. The compression format to be used on the output h5mu object.

id.description: Type: `string`, required, example: `foo`. ID of the sample
id.help_text: Type: `string`, required, example: `foo`. ID of the sample.

input.description: Type: `file`, required, example: `input.h5mu`. Input dataset consisting of the (unlabeled) query observations
input.help_text: Type: `file`, required, example: `input.h5mu`. Input dataset consisting of the (unlabeled) query observations. The dataset is expected to be pre-processed in the same way as the --reference dataset.

modality.description: Type: `string`, default: `rna`. Which modality to process
modality.help_text: Type: `string`, default: `rna`. Which modality to process.

input_layer.description: Type: `string`. Mudata layer (key from layers) to use as input data for scGPT-specific pre-processing (hvg subsetting and binning); if not specified, X is used
input_layer.help_text: Type: `string`. Mudata layer (key from layers) to use as input data for scGPT-specific pre-processing (hvg subsetting and binning); if not specified, X is used.

var_gene_names.description: Type: `string`. The name of the adata var column containing gene names; when no gene_name_layer is provided, the var index will be used
var_gene_names.help_text: Type: `string`. The name of the adata var column containing gene names; when no gene_name_layer is provided, the var index will be used.

obs_batch_label.description: Type: `string`. The name of the adata obs column containing the batch labels
obs_batch_label.help_text: Type: `string`. The name of the adata obs column containing the batch labels.

model.description: Type: `file`, required, example: `best_model.pt`. The model file containing checkpoints and cell type label mapper
model.help_text:
Type: `file`, required, example: `best_model.pt`. The model file containing checkpoints and cell type label mapper. 
Must be a fine-tuned model containing both a key for checkpoints (--finetuned_checkpoints_key) and a cell type label mapper (--label_mapper_key).

model_config.description: Type: `file`, required, example: `args.json`. The model configuration file
model_config.help_text: Type: `file`, required, example: `args.json`. The model configuration file.

model_vocab.description: Type: `file`, required, example: `vocab.json`. Model vocabulary file directory
model_vocab.help_text: Type: `file`, required, example: `vocab.json`. Model vocabulary file directory.

finetuned_checkpoints_key.description: Type: `string`, required, default: `model_state_dict`. Key in the model  file containing the pretrained checkpoints
finetuned_checkpoints_key.help_text: Type: `string`, required, default: `model_state_dict`. Key in the model  file containing the pretrained checkpoints. Required if the provided model is a fine-tuned model containing keys for both the checkpoints and a label mapper.

label_mapper_key.description: Type: `string`, required, default: `id_to_class`. Key in the model file containing the cell type class to label mapper dictionary
label_mapper_key.help_text: Type: `string`, required, default: `id_to_class`. Key in the model file containing the cell type class to label mapper dictionary. Note that the provide model should be a fine-tuned model containing keys for both checkpoints and the label mapper.

pad_token.description: Type: `string`, default: `<pad>`. Token used for padding
pad_token.help_text: Type: `string`, default: `<pad>`. Token used for padding.

pad_value.description: Type: `integer`, default: `-2`. The value of the padding token
pad_value.help_text: Type: `integer`, default: `-2`. The value of the padding token.

n_hvg.description: Type: `integer`, default: `1200`. Number of highly variable genes to subset for
n_hvg.help_text: Type: `integer`, default: `1200`. Number of highly variable genes to subset for.

max_seq_len.description: Type: `integer`. The maximum sequence length of the tokenized data
max_seq_len.help_text: Type: `integer`. The maximum sequence length of the tokenized data.

n_input_bins.description: Type: `integer`, default: `51`. The number of bins to discretize the data into; When no value is provided, data won't be binned
n_input_bins.help_text: Type: `integer`, default: `51`. The number of bins to discretize the data into; When no value is provided, data won't be binned.

seed.description: Type: `integer`. Seed for random number generation used for binning
seed.help_text: Type: `integer`. Seed for random number generation used for binning. If not set, no seed is used.

dsbn.description: Type: `boolean`, default: `true`. Apply domain-specific batch normalization
dsbn.help_text: Type: `boolean`, default: `true`. Apply domain-specific batch normalization

batch_size.description: Type: `integer`, default: `64`. The batch size to be used for embedding inference
batch_size.help_text: Type: `integer`, default: `64`. The batch size to be used for embedding inference.

nextflow input-output arguments.title: Nextflow input-output arguments
nextflow input-output arguments.description: Input/output parameters for Nextflow itself. Please note that both publishDir and publish_dir are supported but at least one has to be configured.

publish_dir.description: Type: `string`, required, example: `output/`. Path to an output directory
publish_dir.help_text: Type: `string`, required, example: `output/`. Path to an output directory.
